full_summary:
**Federated Health Data Management Services (FHDMS) - Summary of Feedback and Outcomes Report**
===========================================

**Reference:** WS3910412840
**Publication Date:** March 27, 2024
**Closing Date:** April 26, 2024, 14:00 ET
**Status:** Expired

**Summary**
-----------

Canadian Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has issued this notice to provide an opportunity for industry stakeholders to provide their feedback on Federated Health Data Management Services (FHDMS) requirements. This Request for Information (RFI) aims to gather insights on how industry stakeholders can assist in satisfying the objectives and requirements outlined in the respective bid solicitation (WS3910412840).

**Details**
-----------

*   Tender Closing Date: April 26, 2024, 14:00 ET
*   Regions of Delivery: Canada
*   Regions of Opportunity: None
*   Industry Category: Information Technology Service Delivery (UNSPSC 81160000)
*   Trade Agreements: None
*   Language of Solicitation: English and French
*   Bid Security: None
*   Language of Service Delivery: English and French

**Document Description**
------------------------

The Summary of Feedback and Outcomes document is for informational purposes only, with no requirement to submit a response. This document will outline the insights and feedback received from industry stakeholders in response to the original RFI.

**Contact Information**
---------------------

To obtain additional information, please contact:

*   Jack Wadas
*   Public Works and Government Services Canada (PSPC)
*   Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage
*   Postal Code: K1A 0S5
*   City: Gatineau
*   Province: Quebec
*   Country: Canada
*   Email: [jack.wadas@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:jack.wadas@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

**Access to Bid Solicitation**
-----------------------------

To access the bid solicitation documentation, please visit the Ariba ONLine site at:

https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19232128?extsite=MTkyMzIxMjhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Please note that this opportunity has expired. If you require further information, please do not hesitate to contact the above-mentioned contact. You may also access
